User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2
Build ID: 20110902133214

Steps to reproduce:

I receive all the messages on all the accounts in a row by clicking on the left lower corner icon (connected /unconnected).


Actual results:

Thunderbird show the accounts one after the other, ask for the password and receive "n" (e.g. 4) messages if any waiting. I have several accounts each with several mailboxes with filters to dispatch message in the right mailboxes.
 Thunderbird is supposed to write a little red sign near the accounts (and in each mailbox) that have received message(s) and mailboxes containing unread messages have their name in bold characters. 
Often I see far less messages mailboxes/accounts signalled than the "n" announced.
I know that a message have more or less legitimate reasons for disappearing :
- the filter has suppressed the message. In this case the Trash mailbox should be signalled and the message in unread state : both are wrong...
- the filter has moved the received message in an other account. The transferred to account and not the receiving one should be signalled. This is not presently true but it is difficult to process and this sort of filter does not occur often.
-the anti-virus has suppressed an infected message but in this case it gives a warning message...
In some cases I find afterwards lost messages marked as unread in a mailbox that is not signalled as containing unread messages... This occurs when I check the mailbox for other reasons.



Expected results:

See in the "What happened" section for each case.

comments.text:
(In reply to :aceman from comment #7)
My version of Thunderbird is now 10.0.2 .

I have recently discovered that there are 2 methods to delete (in fact move to Trash) an incoming message with a filter.
1) the good one : code in the action "Move" and define the destination as the Trash mailbox. The result is what you have described :
> ... the filter Deletes the message (Moves to Trash),
> the message stays UNREAD and the Trash folder IS marked bold and (1) (as
> count of unread messages). This is on TB 11, Win XP, POP3. So this seems
> correct.
I fully agree : this is what TB should do.

2) the bad one : code in the action "Suppress" . The result is : the filter Deletes the message (Moves to Trash), the message becomes READ and the Trash folder IS NOT marked bold and the count of unread messages is 0. I consider that this is a bug...

Unfortunately method 1 needs 2 clicks and most users use method 2 with only 1 click and also because "suppress" seems more obvious than "move to" + "trash". That is the reason of this part of my bug.

How to test this : define 2 filters, one with condition "subject contains suppress" and action "suppress", the other with condition "subject contains trash" and action "move" + "trash" ; and 2 messages one with subject : "suppress" and text "abcd", the other with subject :"trash" text "abcd". Send and receive message 1 then 2 looking each time at the result.
Can you (or someone else) test this on TB 11 and following releases with Win XP, POP3 ?

Idea for correction of the bug : use in case 2 the coding of method 1.

Work around : avoid method 2 and use method 1 for new filters and change action for old ones.

comments.raw_text:
At least following case is known.
   (1) Filter Before junk Classification. Filter moves new mailX to FolderX.
   (2) Junk Filter runs on mailX in FolderX, then moves mailX to Junk.
New mail count for Biff is "number of new mails at step (1)", so phenomenon of this bug may occur.
IIRC, if only one new mail and is moved by filter then moved by Junk filter, "new message number by Biff=1 but no new message in Inbox nor filter move target" is observed.

Some peoples want "Junk filter application and junk move on filter moved mailX",
but other peoples want "no junk move by Junk filter when his message filter moved the mailX".
If Tb's default is for some peoples , other peoples complaint, and if Tb's default is for other peoples, some peoples complaint...
Simplest workaround of above known case is "add mark as NotJunk action to message filter rule when move to folder action is used".
Second workaroud. Use "Filter after Junk Classification" for all message filter rule, instead of defaulted "Filter before Junk Classification"

(In reply to Jean-Marie COUPRIE from comment #10)
> Deletes the message (Moves to Trash), (snip)

Which action in Tb's message fllter?
  (a) Delete
  (b) Move to Trash folder

If (a), change to (b), because "Delete" and "Stop Filter Execution" currently has severe problem.
And, IIUC, "move to folder of messaage filter" keeps Unread status at least when when "Filter before Junk Classificaation".
